item.title: Enable Cluster Gateway
item.description:
This section introduces how to enable cluster gateways.

Attention

If a workspace gateway or project gateway has not been enabled, after enabling the cluster gateway, you will no longer be able to enable the workspace gateway and project gateway.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should be a member of a cluster and have the cluster-admin role in the cluster. For more information, please refer to Cluster Members and Cluster Roles.

item.title: View Gateway Information
item.description:
This section introduces how to view gateway information.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should be a member of a cluster and have the cluster-admin role in the cluster. For more information, please refer to Cluster Members and Cluster Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin role.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the Gateway Settings page, click Cluster Gateway to view the information of the cluster gateway.

    Parameter Description

    Type

item.title: View Cluster Gateway Details
item.description:
This section introduces how to view cluster gateway details.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should be a member of a cluster and have the cluster-admin role in the cluster. For more information, please refer to Cluster Members and Cluster Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin role.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the page, select Manage > View Details to open the gateway details page.

  4. On the gateway details page, view the resource attributes of the gateway in the Attributes area on the left.

    Parameter Description

    Cluster

item.title: Edit Cluster Gateway Settings
item.description:
This section describes how to edit cluster gateway settings.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should be a member of a cluster and have the cluster-admin role in the cluster. For more information, see Cluster Members and Cluster Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin role.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the page, select Manage > Edit.

  4. In the pop-up dialog box, modify the parameters of the gateway, and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    IngressClassName

item.title: Disable Cluster Gateway
item.description:
This section describes how to disable the cluster gateway.

Warning

After disabling the gateway, clients will not be able to access the services reverse-proxied by the gateway, and related business may be interrupted. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should be a member of a cluster and have the cluster-admin role in the cluster. For more information, see Cluster Members and Cluster Roles.

item.title: Appendix: Gateway Logs Not Showing Data in Member Clusters
item.description:
If the "Gateway Logs" tab in the "Cluster Gateway" details page of a member cluster does not display data, you can resolve the issue using the following methods.

  1. Enable the NodePort access mode for the whizard-telemetry-apiserver service on the host cluster.

    1. Under the application workloads menu on the host cluster, click Services to enter the services page.

    2. Search for the service whizard-telemetry-apiserver, click > Edit External Access.

    3. In the Edit External Access dialog, select NodePort, and then click OK.
